title: Thunderbird leaves a “ghost window” on macOS 26
content:
Hi everyone,

I’ve run into a weird issue with Thunderbird on macOS 26 (Tahoe) and I’m wondering if anyone else has seen this.

When I close the main Thunderbird window using Command + W or RedDot Close Button, the window disappears like normal, but something is still left behind. It’s like an invisible or “ghost” window stays on the screen. Because of that, I can’t click anything that was underneath the Thunderbird window. The area is still blocked as if the window never fully closed.

If I open Mission Control (F3), I can see an empty tile where the window should be, which confirms that something is still there even though it’s not visible.

A few details: • The problem happens every time I close the main window with Command + W • Thunderbird keeps running in the background, but I can’t bring the window back unless I quit the app completely • This only happens with Thunderbird, no other app on macOS 26 has this issue on my machines • On previous macOS versions I never had this problem

System info: • macOS 26 (Tahoe), fully updated • Latest stable Thunderbird release • Mac mini M4 and MacBook Air M4

It looks like some kind of window management bug on macOS 26, but only triggered by Thunderbird.

Has anyone else experienced this or knows if it’s a known issue? Thanks!
creator: kordian.net

title: Thunderbird autoupdating
content:
Hi,

Please, can you tell me what can I do to prevent Thunderbird esr auto-updating to release version ?

Thanks.

title: Setting mail account B to use mail account A's Thunderbird inbox results in account A no longer downloading email.
content:
Thunderbird 140.4.0 / Win11Home 24H2

For many years now I have had several email accounts 'share' Thunderbird's Global Inbox (Local Folders) and this has worked fine (by the way I'm using POP throughout).

For a long time I have also had a separate email account (call this account A) using its own Inbox. Again, all has been working fine.

Very recently I created a new account (Account B) and directed this to use Account A's Thunderbird inbox (via Account B's Server Settings, Advanced...) and selected the "Include this server when getting new mail" option. All looked fine at that stage (I did not think to go back and check Account A's Server Settings, Advanced...). Under Account B's Copies and Folders I also directed Account B to use Account A's folders.

As I expected, Account B did not have any of its own folders created.

On selecting Account A in the folder pane and checking for emails (via the Get messages icon at the top of the folder pane), only Account B was checked (as evidenced by the status bar messages scrolling through at the bottom of the window). This was most perplexing - had I somehow lost a whole bunch of messages that I knew should be sitting in the inbox at the mail server?

However, I soon found the culprit. Account A's Server Settings, Advanced.... were completely greyed out (and so effectively disabled) - see image attached.

So setting up a 2nd email account to download to 1st email account's inbox disables downloading of 1st email account's inbox messages. No warning of this is given - it just happens behind the scenes.

Is this all a conscious design decision (and, if so, why?)? Or is it simply a bug? Is there a solution / workaround?

Regards, Bazzaman

Just to be clear, selecting or not selecting "Include this server when getting new mail" option has no impact on this one way or the other - it is the attempted sharing of the inbox that gives rise to the issue.
creator: bazzaman

title: crash: error:  expected value at line 1 column 1
content:
Hi

Thunderbird is crashing with error message: expected value at line 1 column 1

Error message in crash dialog box: " Thunderbird Crash Reporter Thunderbird had a problem and crashed. Unfortunately, the crash reporter is unable to submit a report for this crash. Details expected value at line 1 column 1 Restart Thunderbird | Quit Thunderbird "

troubleshooting so far:

  • How often? periodically (sometime within minutes of loading, sometime hours).
  • uninstalled, rebooted, reinstalled Thunderbird (using winget)
  • created a NEW profile (have to re-download mail / folders ... taking day(s?) ... since when I walk away and come back hoping download has finished but it has crashed) ... not sure when it will get caught up ( main mail file is huge (20+GB) )
  • tried: accessibility.force_disabled changed from 0 to 1 (found suggestion in a google search)
  • tried: troubleshoot mode (even though I don't use any add-ons)
  • I use multiple mail accounts (although currently I'm only using main one, trying to isolate problems)

Thanks for help.
creator: from_mozilla1

title: shared mailboxes on outlook.office35.com email account
content: Hi, is there a way to setup access shared e-mail accounts (they appear as unlicensed accounts in office 365 business accounts)? In office365 business accounts, it is possible to setup general mailboxes like sales@ etc. and grant access of said mailbox to user account of choice. OAuth2 login for these accounts does not exist, instead, login occurs via user accounts and then the shared accounts appear for such user, it is not possible to login with or setup shared mailboxes with a password as it is normal (licensed) user accounts. According to Chat-GPT5 it is difficult or impossible, it says login name would be something like licensedusername@company.com\sharedmailbox@company.com, so for example, eric.smith@contoso.com\sales@contoso.com But that doesn't seem to work, like a silly suggestion, outlook.office365.com server then asks for credentials of said eric.smith@contoso.com\sales@contoso.com as if it were a single username! so if you have any info if that is possible, any work-around, pls let me now! Thank you - Andreas Hartmann (ADEC Technologies Ltd)
